CatDescriptText: Mrs. Gerry Bell, college sophomore, Chicago and Mr. "Doc" Boyd, porter, North Side, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 10, 1960, pg. B1 with question: "Do you favor governmental (state or Federal) aid to education, which would help promising students further their educations, or do you believe that the rising cost of education should be defrayed entirely by the student, his or her parents or relatives?" Mrs. Gerry Bell's answer reads: "The Government should help when the parents are not able to send the child to college...I believe there's a lot of college material which is not getting into college and especially so among the colored people.  These persons and their families cannot afford the costs.  With these students pursuing a higher education, I believe that the educational level and our Government's stature will be raised."  Mr. "Doc" Boyd's answer reads: "I figure the Government should....because it is more able."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of Gerry Bell wearing light colored head scarf and dark plush coat, standing in front of store window with display; Portrait of "Doc" Boyd wearing fedora, moustache, and horizontally striped coat, standing on sidewalk in front of buildings
